verses.roman:
kācid añjalināgṛhṇāt
tanvī tāmbūla-carvitam
ekā tad-aṅghri-kamalaṁ
santaptā stanayor adhāt

synonyms: kācit—one; añjalinā—with joined hands; agṛhṇāt—took; tanvī—slender; tāmbūla—of betel nut; carvitam—His chewed remnants; ekā—one; tat—His; aṅghri—foot; kamalam—lotus; santaptā—burning; stanayoḥ—on her breasts; adhāt—placed.
translation: A slender gopī respectfully took in her joined hands the betel nut He had chewed, and another gopī, burning with desire, put His lotus feet on her breasts.
